text: Hi - I need some help, I am trying to add a file within the custom module in this formate `<script src="{{ get_asset_url('Theme folder name/js/filename.min-4.0.0.js') }}"></script>` and getting the error *"The code has hardcoded theme names in URLs. These should be relative references."* someone please help me to resolve that issue I have already tried a lot of options.

Hey <@U02EHGZTNHG>! It seems like that error message is recommending you use a relative path to the file, instead of an absolute. I’m not sure what your file structure looks like, but it’d be something more like `<script src="{{ get_asset_url('../js/filename.min-4.0.0.js') }}"></script>`. You could also try adding a slash before the theme folder name. More <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/New-Feature-Support-for-relative-file-path-references/m-p/284849#:~:text=The%20HubSpot%20CMS%20now%20supports,they%20live%20in%20a%20project.&text=As%20a%20best%20practice%2C%20all,Manager%20will%20throw%20a%20warning.|here>.
Hi <@U02NJACH5QS>, Thanks for your response its help full for us, I have tried the "../../" then the error fixed.
<@U01B10S09FU> did you come up with a solid solution for this? I’m looking to do something similar
<@U030XEP3QPN> no solution outside of JavaScript unfortunately.
